   19: %%
   20: -module(core_fold_inline_SUITE).
   21: -feature(maybe_expr, enable).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   24: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   25: 	 t_element/1,setelement/1,t_length/1,append/1,t_apply/1,bifs/1,
   26: 	 eq/1,nested_call_in_case/1,guard_try_catch/1,coverage/1,
   27: 	 unused_multiple_values_error/1,unused_multiple_values/1,
   28: 	 multiple_aliases/1,redundant_boolean_clauses/1,
   29: 	 mixed_matching_clauses/1,unnecessary_building/1,
   30: 	 no_no_file/1,configuration/1,supplies/1,
   31:          redundant_stack_frame/1,export_from_case/1,
   32:          empty_values/1,cover_letrec_effect/1,
   33:          receive_effect/1,nested_lets/1,
   34:          map_effect/1]).
   35: 
   36: -export([foo/0,foo/1,foo/2,foo/3]).
   37: 
   38: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   39: 
   40: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   41: 
   42: all() -> 
   43:     [{group,p}].
   44: 
   45: groups() -> 
   46:     [{p,[parallel],
   47:       [t_element,setelement,t_length,append,t_apply,bifs,
   48:        eq,nested_call_in_case,guard_try_catch,coverage,
   49:        unused_multiple_values_error,unused_multiple_values,
   50:        multiple_aliases,redundant_boolean_clauses,
   51:        mixed_matching_clauses,unnecessary_building,
   52:        no_no_file,configuration,supplies,
   53:        redundant_stack_frame,export_from_case,
   54:        empty_values,cover_letrec_effect,
   55:        receive_effect,nested_lets,
   56:        map_effect]}].
   57: 
   58: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   59:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   60:     Config.
   61: 
   62: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   63:     ok.
   64: 
   65: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   66:     Config.
   67: 
   68: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: 
   72: t_element(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   73:     X = make_ref(),
   74:     X = id(element(1, {X,y,z})),
   75:     b = id(element(2, {a,b,c,d})),
   76:     (fun() ->
   77: 	    case {a,#{k=>X}} of
   78: 		{a,#{k:=X}}=Tuple ->
   79: 		    #{k:=X} = id(element(2, Tuple))
   80: 	    end
   81:     end)(),
   82: 
   83:     %% No optimization, but should work.
   84:     Tuple = id({x,y,z}),
   85:     Pos = id(3),
   86:     x = id(element(1, Tuple)),
   87:     c = id(element(Pos, {a,b,c,d})),
   88:     X = id(element(Pos, {a,b,X,d})),
   89:     z = id(element(Pos, Tuple)),
   90: 
   91:     %% Calls that will fail.
   92:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(5, {a,b,c,d})),
   93:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(5, {a,b,X,d})),
   94:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(5.0, {a,b,X,d})),
   95:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(2, not_a_tuple)),
   96:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(2, [])),
   97:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(2, Tuple == 3)),
   98:     case id({a,b,c}) of
   99: 	{_,_,_}=Tup ->
  100: 	    {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(4, Tup))
  101:     end,
  102:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(1, tuple_size(Tuple))),
  103: 
  104:     ok.
  105: 
  106: setelement(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  107:     X = id(b),
  108:     New = id([1,2,3]),
  109:     {y,b,c} = id(setelement(1, {a,b,c}, y)),
  110:     {y,b,c} = id(setelement(1, {a,X,c}, y)),
  111:     {a,y,c} = id(setelement(2, {a,X,c}, y)),
  112:     {a,[1,2,3],c} = id(setelement(2, {a,b,c}, New)),
  113:     {a,[1,2,3],c} = id(setelement(2, {a,X,c}, New)),
  114:     {a,b,[1,2,3]} = id(setelement(3, {a,b,c}, New)),
  115:     {a,b,[1,2,3]} = id(setelement(3, {a,X,c}, New)),
  116: 
  117:     {{d,c,b,a,x}, {z,c,b,a,x}} = setelement_cover(erlang:make_tuple(5, x)),
  118: 
  119:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch setelement_crash({a,b,c,d,e,f})),
  120:     error = setelement_crash_2({a,b,c,d,e,f}, <<42>>),
  121: 
  122:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch setelement(1, not_a_tuple, New)),
  123:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch setelement(3, {a,b}, New)),
  124: 
  125:     ok.
  126: 
  127: setelement_cover(T0) ->
  128:     T1 = setelement(4, T0, a),
  129:     T2 = setelement(3, T1, b),
  130:     T3 = setelement(2, T2, c),
  131:     T4 = setelement(1, T3, d),
  132:     T5 = setelement(1, T3, z),
  133:     {T4,T5}.
  134: 
  135: setelement_crash(Tuple) ->
  136:     %% Used to crash the compiler because sys_core_dsetel did not notice that
  137:     %% X1 was used in bit syntax construction.
  138:     X1 = setelement(5, Tuple, new),
  139:     X2 = setelement(3, X1, new),
  140:     {X2,<<X1>>}.
  141: 
  142: setelement_crash_2(Tuple, Bin) ->
  143:     %% Used to crash the compiler because sys_core_dsetel did not notice that
  144:     %% X1 was used as a size field in bit syntax matching.
  145:     X1 = setelement(5, Tuple, new),
  146:     X2 = setelement(3, X1, new),
  147:     case Bin of
  148: 	<<42:X1>> -> X2;
  149: 	_ -> error
  150:     end.
  151: 
  152: t_length(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  153:     Blurf = id({blurf,a,b}),
  154:     Tail = id([42,43,44,45]),
  155:     0 = id(length([])),
  156:     1 = id(length([x])),
  157:     2 = id(length([x,Blurf])),
  158:     4 = id(length([x,Blurf,a,b])),
  159: 
  160:     %% No or partial optimization.
  161:     4 = length(Tail),
  162:     5 = id(length([x|Tail])),
  163: 
  164:     %% Will fail.
  165:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch id(length([a,b|c]))),
  166:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch id(length([a,Blurf|c]))),
  167:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch id(length(atom))),
  168: 
  169:     ok.
  170: 
  171: -define(APPEND(A, B), (fun(Res) ->
  172: 			       Res = lists:append(A, B),
  173: 			       Res = erlang:append(A, B),
  174: 			       Res = erlang:'++'(A, B)
  175: 		       end)(A++B)).
  176: 
  177: append(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  178:     A = id(0),
  179:     [a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,i,j,k] = id(?APPEND([a,b,c,d,e,f],[g,h,i,j,k])),
  180:     [a,b,c,d,e] = id(?APPEND([a,b,c],id([d,e]))),
  181:     [0,1,2,3,4,5,6] = id(?APPEND([A,1,2,3],[4,5,6])),
  182:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch id(?APPEND([A|blurf],[4,5,6]))),
  183:     ok.
  184: 
  185: t_apply(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  186:     ok = apply(?MODULE, foo, []),
  187:     4 = apply(?MODULE, foo, [3]),
  188:     7 = apply(?MODULE, foo, [3,4]),
  189:     12 = apply(?MODULE, foo, [id(8),4]),
  190:     21 = apply(?MODULE, foo, [8,id(9),4]),
  191:     20 = apply(?MODULE, foo, [8,8,id(4)]),
  192:     24 = apply(?MODULE, foo, [id(10),10,4]),
  193: 
  194:     M = id(?MODULE),
  195:     ok = apply(M, foo, []),
  196:     4 = apply(M, foo, [3]),
  197:     16.0 = apply(M, foo, [12.0,4]),
  198: 
  199:     %% Will fail.
  200:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply([a,b,c], foo, [])),
  201:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply(42, foo, [])),
  202:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply(?MODULE, 45, [xx])),
  203:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply(?MODULE, foo, {a,b})),
  204:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply(M, M, [1009|10010])),
  205:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply(?MODULE, foo, [10000|9999])),
  206:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply(?MODULE, foo, a)),
  207: 
  208:     ok.
  209: 
  210: foo() ->
  211:     ok.
  212: 
  213: foo(A) ->
  214:     A+1.
  215: 
  216: foo(A, B) ->
  217:     A + B.
  218: 
  219: foo(A, B, C) ->
  220:     A + B + C.
  221: 
  222: bifs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  223:     <<1,2,3,4>> = id(list_to_binary([1,2,3,4])),
  224:     K = {a,key},
  225:     V = {a,value},
  226:     {ok,#{K:=V}} = id(list_to_tuple([ok,#{K=>V}])),
  227:     ok.
  228: 
  229: -define(CMP_SAME0(A0, B), (fun(A) -> true = A == B, false = A /= B end)(id(A0))).
  230: -define(CMP_SAME1(A0, B), (fun(A) -> false = A /= B, true = A == B end)(id(A0))).
  231: -define(CMP_SAME(A0, B), (true = ?CMP_SAME0(A0, B) =:= not ?CMP_SAME1(A0, B))).
  232: 
  233: -define(CMP_DIFF0(A0, B), (fun(A) -> false = A == B, true = A /= B end)(id(A0))).
  234: -define(CMP_DIFF1(A0, B), (fun(A) -> true = A /= B, false = A == B end)(id(A0))).
  235: -define(CMP_DIFF(A0, B), (true = ?CMP_DIFF0(A0, B) =:= not ?CMP_DIFF1(A0, B))).
  236: 
  237: eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  238:     ?CMP_SAME([a,b,c], [a,b,c]),
  239:     ?CMP_SAME([42.0], [42.0]),
  240:     ?CMP_SAME([42], [42]),
  241:     ?CMP_SAME([42.0], [42]),
  242: 
  243:     ?CMP_DIFF(a, [a]),
  244:     ?CMP_DIFF(a, {1,2,3}),
  245: 
  246:     ?CMP_SAME(#{a=>1.0,b=>2}, #{b=>2.0,a=>1}),
  247:     ?CMP_SAME(#{a=>[1.0],b=>[2]}, #{b=>[2.0],a=>[1]}),
  248: 
  249:     %% The rule for comparing keys are different in 17.x and 18.x.
  250:     %% Just test that the results are consistent.
  251:     Bool = id(#{1=>a}) == id(#{1.0=>a}),	%Unoptimizable.
  252:     Bool = id(#{1=>a}) == #{1.0=>a},		%Optimizable.
  253:     Bool = #{1=>a} == #{1.0=>a},		%Optimizable.
  254:     io:format("Bool = ~p\n", [Bool]),
  255: 
  256:     ok.
  257: 
  258: %% OTP-7117.
  259: nested_call_in_case(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  260:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  261:     Dir = test_lib:get_data_dir(Config),
  262:     Core = filename:join(Dir, "nested_call_in_case"),
  263:     Opts = [from_core,{outdir,PrivDir}|test_lib:opt_opts(?MODULE)],
  264:     io:format("~p", [Opts]),
  265:     {ok,Mod} = c:c(Core, Opts),
  266:     yes = Mod:a([1,2,3], 2),
  267:     no = Mod:a([1,2,3], 4),
  268:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch Mod:a(not_a_list, 42)),
  269:     _ = code:delete(Mod),
  270:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  271:     ok.
  272: 
  273: guard_try_catch(_Config) ->
  274:     false = do_guard_try_catch(key, value),
  275:     value = get(key),
  276:     ok.
  277: 
  278: do_guard_try_catch(K, V) ->
  279:     %% This try...catch block looks like a guard.
  280:     %% Make sure that it is not optimized like a guard
  281:     %% (the put/2 call must not be optimized away).
  282:     try
  283: 	put(K, V),
  284: 	false
  285:     catch
  286: 	_:_ ->
  287: 	    false
  288:     end.
  289: 
  290: -record(cover_opt_guard_try, {list=[]}).
  291: 
  292: coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  293:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,{a,b,c}},_}} =
  294: 	(catch cover_will_match_list_type({a,b,c})),
  295:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,{a,b,c,d}},_}} =
  296: 	(catch cover_will_match_list_type({a,b,c,d})),
  297:     a = cover_remove_non_vars_alias({a,b,c}),
  298:     error = cover_will_match_lit_list(),
  299:     {ok,[a]} = cover_is_safe_bool_expr(a),
  300:     false = cover_is_safe_bool_expr2(a),
  301:     ok = cover_eval_is_function(fun id/1),
  302: 
  303:     ok = cover_opt_guard_try(#cover_opt_guard_try{list=[a]}),
  304:     error = cover_opt_guard_try(#cover_opt_guard_try{list=[]}),
  305: 
  306:     %% Make sure that we don't attempt to make literals
  307:     %% out of pids. (Putting a pid into a #c_literal{}
  308:     %% would crash later compiler passes.)
  309:     case list_to_pid("<0.42.0>") of
  310: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) -> ok
  311:     end,
  312: 
  313:     %% Cover the non-variable case in bsm_do_an/4.
  314:     ok = bsm_an_inlined(<<1>>, Config),
  315:     error = bsm_an_inlined(<<1,2,3>>, Config),
  316:     error = bsm_an_inlined([], Config),
  317: 
  318:     %% Cover eval_rel_op/4.
  319:     Tuple = id({a,b}),
  320:     false = case Tuple of
  321: 		{_,_} ->
  322: 		    Tuple =:= true
  323: 	    end,
  324: 
  325:     %% Cover is literal_fun/1.
  326:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,42},_}} = (catch cover_is_literal_fun()),
  327: 
  328:     %% Cover core_lib.
  329:     ok = cover_core_lib([ok,nok]),
  330: 
  331:     ok.
  332: 
  333: cover_will_match_list_type(A) ->
  334:     case A of
  335: 	{a,_,_} ->				%Set type of A to {a,_,_}.
  336: 	    case A of
  337: 		{a,_,_,_} -> ok			%Compare type and pattern.
  338: 	    end
  339:     end.
  340: 
  341: %% Make sure the remove_non_vars/4 can handle aliases in the type argument.
  342: cover_remove_non_vars_alias(X) ->
  343:     case X of
  344: 	{a=Y,_,_} ->				%Set type of A to {a=Y,_,_}.
  345: 	    case X of
  346: 		{_,_,_} ->			%Compare type and pattern.
  347: 		    Y
  348: 	    end
  349:     end.
  350: 
  351: cover_will_match_lit_list() ->
  352:     case {1,2,3} of				%Literal case expression.
  353: 	{_,$A,$A} ->				%Pattern that does not match.
  354: 	    ok;
  355: 	_ ->
  356: 	    error
  357:     end.
  358: 
  359: cover_is_safe_bool_expr(X) ->
  360:     %% Use a try...catch that looks like a try...catch in a guard.
  361:     try
  362: 	%% let V = [X] in {ok,V}
  363: 	%%    is_safe_simple([X]) ==> true
  364: 	%%    is_safe_bool_expr([X]) ==> false
  365: 	V = [X],
  366: 	{ok,V}
  367:     catch
  368: 	_:_ ->
  369: 	    false
  370:     end.
  371: 
  372: cover_is_safe_bool_expr2(X) ->
  373:     try
  374: 	V = [X],
  375:     is_function(V, 1)
  376:     catch
  377: 	_:_ ->
  378: 	    false
  379:     end.
  380: 
  381: cover_opt_guard_try(Msg) ->
  382:     if
  383: 	length(Msg#cover_opt_guard_try.list) =/= 1 ->
  384: 	    error;
  385: 	true ->
  386: 	    ok
  387:     end.
  388: 
  389: cover_eval_is_function(X) ->
  390:     case X of
  391:         {a,_} -> is_function(X);
  392:         _ -> ok
  393:     end.
  394: 
  395: bsm_an_inlined(<<_:8>>, _) -> ok;
  396: bsm_an_inlined(_, _) -> error.
  397: 
  398: cover_is_literal_fun() ->
  399:     [case id(42) of
  400:          [] ->
  401:              try right of
  402:                  wrong -> true
  403:              catch
  404:                  error:_ -> error
  405:              end
  406:      end]().
  407: 
  408: cover_core_lib(Modules) ->
  409:     R = id(Modules),
  410:     _ = [id(Error) || Error <- R, element(1, Error) =/= ok],
  411:     ok.
  412: 
  413: unused_multiple_values_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  414:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  415:     Dir = test_lib:get_data_dir(Config),
  416:     Core = filename:join(Dir, "unused_multiple_values_error"),
  417:     Opts = [no_copt,clint,ssalint,return,from_core,{outdir,PrivDir}
  418: 	   |test_lib:opt_opts(?MODULE)],
  419:     {error,[{"unused_multiple_values_error",
  420: 	     [{none,core_lint,{return_mismatch,{hello,1}}}]}],
  421:      []} = c:c(Core, Opts),
  422:     ok.
  423: 
  424: unused_multiple_values(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  425:     put(unused_multiple_values, []),
  426:     [false] = test_unused_multiple_values(false),
  427:     [b,a,{a,b},false] = test_unused_multiple_values({a,b}),
  428:     ok.
  429: 
  430: test_unused_multiple_values(X) ->
  431:     ok = do_unused_multiple_values(X),
  432:     get(unused_multiple_values).
  433: 
  434: do_unused_multiple_values(X) ->
  435:     case do_something(X) of
  436:         false ->
  437:             A = false;
  438:         Res ->
  439:             {A,B} = Res,
  440:             do_something(A),
  441:             do_something(B)
  442:     end,
  443:     _ThisShouldNotFail = A,
  444:     ok.
  445: 
  446: do_something(I) ->
  447:     put(unused_multiple_values,
  448: 	[I|get(unused_multiple_values)]),
  449:     I.
  450: 
  451: 
  452: %% Make sure that multiple aliases does not cause
  453: %% the case expression to be evaluated twice.
  454: multiple_aliases(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  455:     do_ma(fun() ->
  456: 		  X = Y = run_once(),
  457: 		  {X,Y}
  458: 	  end, {ok,ok}),
  459:     do_ma(fun() ->
  460: 		  case {true,run_once()} of
  461: 		      {true=A=B,ok=X=Y} ->
  462: 			  {A,B,X,Y}
  463: 		  end
  464: 	  end, {true,true,ok,ok}),
  465:     ok.
  466: 
  467: do_ma(Fun, Expected) when is_function(Fun, 0) ->
  468:     Expected = Fun(),
  469:     ran_once = erase(run_once),
  470:     ok.
  471: 
  472: run_once() ->
  473:     undefined = put(run_once, ran_once),
  474:     ok.
  475: 
  476: 
  477: redundant_boolean_clauses(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  478:   X = id(0),
  479:   yes = case X == 0 of
  480:             false -> no;
  481:             false -> no;
  482:             true -> yes
  483:         end.
  484: 
  485: mixed_matching_clauses(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  486:   0 = case #{} of
  487:           #{} -> 0;
  488:           a -> 1
  489:       end,
  490:   0 = case <<>> of
  491:           <<>> -> 0;
  492:           a -> 1
  493:       end,
  494:   ok.
  495: 
  496: unnecessary_building(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  497:     Term1 = do_unnecessary_building_1(test_lib:id(a)),
  498:     [{a,a},{a,a}] = Term1,
  499:     7 = erts_debug:size(Term1),
  500: 
  501:     %% The Input term should not be rebuilt (thus, it should
  502:     %% only be counted once in the size of the combined term).
  503:     Input = test_lib:id({a,b,c}),
  504:     Term2 = test_lib:id(do_unnecessary_building_2(Input)),
  505:     {b,[{a,b,c},none],x} = Term2,
  506:     4+4+4+2 = erts_debug:size([Term2|Input]),
  507: 
  508:     ok.
  509: 
  510: do_unnecessary_building_1(S) ->
  511:     %% The tuple must only be built once.
  512:     F0 = F1 = {S,S},
  513:     [F0,F1].
  514: 
  515: do_unnecessary_building_2({a,_,_}=T) ->
  516:     %% The T term should not be rebuilt.
  517:     {b,
  518:      [_,_] = [T,none],
  519:      x}.
  520: 
  521: %% This test tests that v3_core has provided annotations and that
  522: %% sys_core_fold retains them, so that warnings produced by
  523: %% sys_core_fold will have proper filenames and line numbers. Thus, no
  524: %% "no_file" warnings.
  525: no_no_file(_Config) ->
  526:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,0},_}} = (catch source(true, any)),
  527:     surgery = (tim(#{reduction => any}))(),
  528: 
  529:     false = soul(#{[] => true}),
  530:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,true},_}} = (catch soul(#{[] => false})),
  531: 
  532:     ok = experiment(),
  533:     ok.
  534: 
  535: source(true, Activities) ->
  536:     case 0 of
  537: 	Activities when [] ->
  538: 	    Activities
  539:     end.
  540: 
  541: tim(#{reduction := _Emergency}) ->
  542:     try
  543: 	fun() -> surgery end
  544:     catch
  545: 	_ when [] ->
  546: 	    planet
  547:     end.
  548: 
  549: soul(#{[] := Properly}) ->
  550:     not case true of
  551: 	    Properly -> true;
  552: 	    Properly -> 0
  553: 	end.
  554: 
  555: experiment() ->
  556:     case kingdom of
  557: 	_ ->
  558: 	    +case "map" of
  559: 		 _ -> 0.0
  560: 	     end
  561:     end,
  562:     ok.
  563: 
  564: 
  565: %% Make sure we don't try to move a fun into a guard.
  566: configuration(_Config) ->
  567:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch configuration()),
  568:     ok.
  569: 
  570: configuration() ->
  571:     [forgotten || _Components <- enemy, is_tuple(fun art/0)].
  572: 
  573: art() ->
  574:  creating.
  575: 
  576: %% core_lint would complain after optimization. A call to error/1
  577: %% must not occur unconditionally in a guard.
  578: supplies(_Config) ->
  579:     case ?MODULE of
  580: 	core_fold_inline_SUITE ->
  581: 	    %% Other error behaviour when inlined.
  582: 	    ok;
  583: 	_ ->
  584: 	    {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch do_supplies(#{1 => <<1,2,3>>})),
  585: 	    {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch do_supplies(#{1 => a})),
  586: 	    {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch do_supplies(42)),
  587: 	    ok
  588:     end.
  589: 
  590: do_supplies(#{1 := Value}) when byte_size(Value), byte_size(kg) -> working.
  591: 
  592: redundant_stack_frame(_Config) ->
  593:     {1,2} = do_redundant_stack_frame(#{x=>1,y=>2}),
  594:     {'EXIT',{{badkey,_,x},_}} = (catch do_redundant_stack_frame(#{y=>2})),
  595:     {'EXIT',{{badkey,_,y},_}} = (catch do_redundant_stack_frame(#{x=>1})),
  596:     ok.
  597: 
  598: do_redundant_stack_frame(Map) ->
  599:     %% There should not be a stack frame for this function.
  600:     X = case Map of
  601:             #{x := X0} ->
  602:                 X0;
  603:             #{} ->
  604:                 erlang:error({badkey, Map, x})
  605:         end,
  606:     Y = case Map of
  607:             #{y := Y0} ->
  608:                 Y0;
  609:             #{} ->
  610:                 erlang:error({badkey, Map, y})
  611:         end,
  612:     {X, Y}.
  613: 
  614: %% Cover some clauses in sys_core_fold:remove_first_value/2.
  615: 
  616: -record(export_from_case, {val}).
  617: 
  618: export_from_case(_Config) ->
  619:     a = export_from_case_1(true),
  620:     b = export_from_case_1(false),
  621: 
  622:     R = #export_from_case{val=0},
  623:     {ok,R} = export_from_case_2(false, R),
  624:     {ok,#export_from_case{val=42}} = export_from_case_2(true, R),
  625: 
  626:     ok.
  627: 
  628: export_from_case_1(Bool) ->
  629:     case Bool of
  630:         true ->
  631:             id(42),
  632:             Result = a;
  633:         false ->
  634:             Result = b
  635:     end,
  636:     id(Result).
  637: 
  638: export_from_case_2(Bool, Rec) ->
  639:     case Bool of
  640:         false ->
  641:             Result = Rec;
  642:         true ->
  643:             Result = Rec#export_from_case{val=42}
  644:     end,
  645:     {ok,Result}.
  646: 
  647: empty_values(_Config) ->
  648:     case ?MODULE of
  649:         core_fold_inline_SUITE ->
  650:             {'EXIT',_} = (catch do_empty_values());
  651:         _ ->
  652:             {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch do_empty_values())
  653:     end,
  654:     ok.
  655: 
  656: do_empty_values() when (#{})#{} ->
  657:     c.
  658: 
  659: cover_letrec_effect(_Config) ->
  660:     self() ! {tag,42},
  661:     _ = try
  662:             try
  663:                 ignore
  664:             after
  665:                 receive
  666:                     {tag,Int}=Term ->
  667:                         Res = #{k => {Term,<<Int:16>>}},
  668:                         self() ! Res
  669:                 end
  670:             end
  671:         after
  672:             ok
  673:         end,
  674:     receive
  675:         Any ->
  676:             #{k := {{tag,42},<<42:16>>}} = Any
  677:     end,
  678: 
  679:     _ = catch cover_letrec_effect_1(),
  680:     _ = catch cover_letrec_effect_2(),
  681: 
  682:     ok.
  683: 
  684: cover_letrec_effect_1() ->
  685:     try
  686:         _ = catch ""
  687:     after
  688:         case any_atom of
  689:             31 when any_atom, force ->
  690:                 true
  691:         end,
  692:         case "RG" of
  693:             1 when car, cdr, 3; 3, 4 ->
  694:                 false
  695:         end
  696:     end.
  697: 
  698: cover_letrec_effect_2() ->
  699:     maybe
  700: 	<< ok || ok, _ <- (catch ok)>>,
  701: 	ok
  702:     end.
  703: 
  704: receive_effect(_Config) ->
  705:     self() ! whatever,
  706:     {} = do_receive_effect(),
  707:     ok.
  708: 
  709: do_receive_effect() ->
  710:     {} = receive _ -> {} = {} end.
  711: 
  712: nested_lets(_Config) ->
  713:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,ok},_}} = catch nested_lets_1(<<42>>),
  714:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = catch nested_lets_2(id(0), id(0)),
  715:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = catch nested_lets_3(),
  716:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = catch nested_lets_4(),
  717:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,_},_}} = catch nested_lets_5(),
  718:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = catch nested_lets_6(),
  719: 
  720:     ok.
  721: 
  722: %% GH-6572: Deeply nested `let` expressions caused `sys_core_fold` to generate
  723: %% unsafe code that it would attempt to fix up later. Unfortunately it did so
  724: %% through a limited fixpoint iteration, and would leak said code once the
  725: %% limit was hit.
  726: nested_lets_1(<<X>>) ->
  727:     Y =
  728:         case ok of
  729:             X ->
  730:                 true = (ok > (Y = -1)),
  731:                 <<>> =
  732:                     {id(
  733:                        <<
  734:                          (ok - ok),
  735:                          (bnot ok),
  736:                          (nested_lets_1_f() band ok),
  737:                          (nested_lets_1_f()),
  738:                          (not ok),
  739:                          (ok or nested_lets_1_f()),
  740:                          (id(
  741:                             id(
  742:                               <<
  743:                                 (id(
  744:                                    <<
  745:                                      (id(
  746:                                         <<0 || _ <- []>>
  747:                                        ))
  748:                                    >>
  749:                                   ) * ok)
  750:                               >>
  751:                              )
  752:                            ))
  753:                        >>
  754:                       )}
  755:         end.
  756: 
  757: nested_lets_1_f() ->
  758:     ok.
  759: 
  760: %% GH-6612: A variant of GH-6572 that slipped through the initial fix.
  761: nested_lets_2(X, 0) ->
  762:     try
  763:         0 = {
  764:              _ = 0 + 0,
  765:              Z = bnot ok,
  766:              {(_ = ok), (_ = X)}#{ok => ok},
  767:              ok +
  768:                  (nested_lets_2_f(
  769:                     ok +
  770:                         nested_lets_2_f(
  771:                           ok +
  772:                               (nested_lets_2_f(
  773:                                                 (Y =
  774:                                                      -nested_lets_2_f(
  775:                                                         #{
  776:                                                             (ok +
  777:                                                                  (ok +
  778:                                                                       nested_lets_2_f(
  779:                                                                         case
  780:                                                                             try ok of
  781:                                                                                 _ ->
  782:                                                                                     fun(_) ->
  783:                                                                                             ok
  784:                                                                                     end
  785:                                                                             after
  786:                                                                                 ok
  787:                                                                             end
  788:                                                                         of
  789:                                                                             #{} ->
  790:                                                                                 ok
  791:                                                                         end
  792:                                                                        ))) => ok
  793:                                                          } > ok
  794:                                                        ))
  795:                                 ) + ok)
  796:                          ) >
  797:                         ok
  798:                    ))
  799:             }
  800:     of
  801:         _ ->
  802:             Z;
  803:         _ ->
  804:             Y
  805:     after
  806:         ok
  807:     end.
  808: 
  809: nested_lets_2_f(_) ->
  810:     ok.
  811: 
  812: nested_lets_3() ->
  813:     try ((true = [X | _]) = (ok * (_ = ok))) of
  814:         _ ->
  815:             X
  816:     after
  817:         ok
  818:     end.
  819: 
  820: nested_lets_4() ->
  821:     try
  822:         not (case {(_ = ok), (Y = ?MODULE:undef())} of
  823:             a ->
  824:                 ok;
  825:             0 ->
  826:                 ok
  827:         end)
  828:     of
  829:         _ ->
  830:             Y
  831:     after
  832:         ok
  833:     end.
  834: 
  835: %% GH-6633.
  836: nested_lets_5() ->
  837:     case self() of
  838:         [_ | X] ->
  839:             ok;
  840:         false ->
  841:             {ok#{
  842:                 (X = ok) :=
  843:                     ((ok /=
  844:                         maybe
  845:                             ok
  846:                         end) =/= ok)
  847:             }}
  848:     end,
  849:     X.
  850: 
  851: %% GH-6635.
  852: nested_lets_6() ->
  853:     try {not (false orelse (ok#{(1 / 0) := ok})), X = ok} of
  854:         X ->
  855:             ok
  856:     after
  857:         ok
  858:     end.
  859: 
  860: map_effect(_Config) ->
  861:     {'EXIT',{{badkey,key},_}} = catch map_effect_1(),
  862: 
  863:     {'EXIT',{{badkey,key},_}} = catch map_effect_2(#{}),
  864:     {'EXIT',{{badmap,no_map},_}} = catch map_effect_2(no_map),
  865: 
  866:     ok.
  867: 
  868: map_effect_1() ->
  869:     #{}#{key := value},
  870:     ok.
  871: 
  872: map_effect_2(Map) ->
  873:     Map#{key := value},
  874:     ok.
  875: 
  876: %%% Common utility functions.
  877: 
  878: id(I) -> I.
